results.title: Kimberley: Wandjina country (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Belinda Wright and Stanley Breeden are naturalists and photographers who work with the National Geographic Society. As they become fascinated with the “Wandjina” rock paintings, the viewer also gains some insight into the deep, spiritual relationship the Aboriginal people have with the land.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Morgan, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions

results.title: The Australian Alps: Mirka's Palace of Dreams
results.creator_credit: David Greig, David Morgan and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
This program is the last in a series of 6 documentaries that examine the wilderness areas of Australia.
Mirka Mora is an eccentric artist, French by birth, who had never before ventured into the wilderness nor slept in a tent. Along with Tim McCartney Snape, the first Australian ever to reach the summit of Mt. Everest, and a Nepalese Sherpa, she travels into the Kosciusko wilderness. Mirka’s unique and expressive personality helps viewers see and experience this wilderness from an artist’s perspective. A Teacher’s guide accompanies the video.
results.title_for_label: The Australian Alps: Mirka’s Palace of Dreams
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Greig, David Morgan and Kestrel Film Productions

results.title: Central Australia: tracks in the sand
results.creator_credit: John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Cartoonist Michael Leunig records his impressions of Alice Springs, Ayers Rock and the vast emptiness of the Simpson Desert. Viewers are privy to a special meeting of minds and cultures, when he shares a canvas on the sand with Aboriginal artist, Michael Nelson. Accompanied by a Teacher’s guide.

results.title: Daintree: The Vanishing Rainforest (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Danae Gunn, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
A child returns from the future, a time when forests no longer exist and we see the rainforest and its most unusual inhabitants through her eyes. She grows to love the forest and cannot understand some of the things she sees happening. An imaginative and fascinating story which emphasises the delicate balance of nature, and how easily it can be destroyed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Danae Gunn, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions

results.title: Kakadu: land of the crocodile (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: David Greig, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Val Plumwood, environmental philosopher returns to Kakadu, where she was the victim of a crocodile attack. Against the backdrop of the steamy, intensely beautiful Kakadu National Park, viewers share her thoughts on wilderness and wildlife.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Greig, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
